name: Siebel eScript: Avoid missing default Case handling in Switch Construct in Functions
description: This rule searches for eScripts that contain no 'default' statement in a 'switch' block.
output: This rule reports Functions without a default Case in a Switch
rationale:
The keyword DEFAULT is executed when none of the conditions being tested for in the Switch statement are met or executed.
Having no DEFAULT means that there is a strong assumption about the value of data.
The cases that are "impossible" today are the ones most likely to be the causes of untraceable bugs in the future, when the impossible changes to the standard.
This can lead to unpredictable behavior or even data corruption.
remediation: Add a DEFAULT clause into each SWITCH statement.
total: Number of added or modified eScripts
alternativeName: Siebel eScript: Avoid missing default Case handling in Switch Construct in Functions

technicalCriteria.name: ASCMM-MNT-1 - Control Flow Transfer Control Element outside Switch Block
CWE-1075: Unconditional Control Flow Transfer outside of Switch Block
CWE-478: Missing Default Case in Switch Statement
Complexity - Algorithmic and Control Structure Complexity

qualityStandards.name: Control Flow Transfer Control Element outside Switch Block
qualityStandards.description:
Objective
Avoid the unconditional transfer of control flow outside of switch structures

Consequence
Software that does not follow the principles of structured programming degrades comprehensibility

Measure Element
Number of instances where an unconditional transfer of control is located outside the branching based on the value of a storable element

qualityStandards.name: Missing Default Case in Switch Statement
qualityStandards.description: The code does not have a default case in a switch statement, which might lead to complex logical errors and resultant weaknesses.

qualityStandards.name: Unconditional Control Flow Transfer outside of Switch Block
qualityStandards.description: The software performs unconditional control transfer (such as a goto) in code outside of a branching structure such as a switch block.
